article.title: Evaluating the New Automatic Method for the Analysis of Absorption Spectra Using Synthetic Spectra

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the grayscale plot above the figure represent?
choices: The residuals between the BMA model and the data.
The relative likelihood of velocity components at each pixel.
The flux of the quasar spectrum as a function of wavelength.
The instrumental profile used to convolve the synthetic spectra.

multiple_choice_question.text: How many data regions are shown in Figure 2 that contribute to the Δα/α analysis?
What do the gray vertical lines in Figure 3 represent?
choices: The central position of each underlying velocity component.
The positions of the strongest absorption features in the spectrum.
The wavelengths of the transitions used in the analysis.
The statistical uncertainties on the velocity component parameters.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the underlying (real) value of Δα/α used to generate the synthetic spectra in Figure 4?
What trend is observed in the statistical uncertainties of the Δα/α estimates as the absorption system complexity increases?
